ernest
Interface IErnest

All Known Implementing Classes:
Ernest
public interface IErnest

The interface through which the environment can use an Ernest agent.

Author:
ogeorgeon

Method Summary

Method Detail

setParameters

void setParameters(int regularityThreshold,
                   int schemaMaxLength)
Set Ernest's fundamental learning parameters. Use null to leave a value unchanged.

Parameters:
regularityThreshold - The Regularity Sensibility Threshold.
schemaMaxLength - The Maximum Schema Length.

setSensorymotorSystem

void setSensorymotorSystem(ISensorymotorSystem sensorymotorSystem)
Set Ernest's sensorymotor system. (The sensorymotor system is instantiated by the environment so that the environment can choose the suitable sensorymotor system)

Parameters:
sensorymotorSystem - Ernest's sensorymotor system

setTracer

void setTracer(ITracer tracer)
Initialize the tracer that generates Ernest's activity trace. (The tracer is instantiated by the environment so that the environment can choose the suitable tracer and also use it to trace things)

Parameters:
tracer - The tracer.

internalState

java.lang.String internalState()
Get a description of Ernest's internal state. (This is used to display Ernest's internal state in the environment)

Returns:
A representation of Ernest's internal state

step

java.lang.String step(boolean status)
Run Ernest one step. (All environments return at least a boolean feedback from Ernest's actions)

Parameters:
status - The status received as feedback from the previous schema enaction.
Returns:
The next primitive schema to enact.

step

java.lang.String step(int[][] matrix)
Run Ernest one step.

Parameters:
matrix - The matrix of stimuli received from the environment.
Returns:
The next primitive schema to enact.

getObservation

IObservation getObservation()
Returns:
Ernest observation used to draw the local map in the environment

getStaticSystem

StaticSystem getStaticSystem()
Returns:
a pointer to Ernest's static system to be used by other modules
